p: The 1.76% acid value reflects stability against neutralization and the peroxide index value, 4.00 meq/kg, indicates greater resistance to oxidation. The pH obtained a value of 4.54, with this parameter being important as it indicates an inhibitory range of several bacterial strains [ 15]. The refractive index corresponded to 1.46, where this criterion is widely used for oil quality and identity analysis. The density found via direct measurement was 0.304 (g/cmÂ³).
